ch.aplu.jcardgame

Class CardGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • ch.aplu.android.GameGrid
              • ch.aplu.jcardgame.CardGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.media.MediaPlayer.OnCompletionListener, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, GGActListener

    public class CardGame
extends GameGrid
    A specialized GameGrid class used for card games.

    We provide an auto zoom feature by using the WindowZoom parameters in the CardGame constructor. All card images and locations are automatically zoomed by a zoom factor calculated from the current screen size. Collision and touch areas are displaced and zoomed accordingly. The zoom factor may also be set by setZoomFactor(). A zoom factor 1 disables auto zoom.

    Guidelines for using auto zoom:

    - Assume a fixed size game, e.g. 1000x1000 pixels, assuming a virtual coordinate system x = 0..1000, y = 0..1000. - Use card pictures with image sizes that fit well into this window (e.g. 100x150 pixels)
    - Use GameGrid constructor with windowZoom(1000)
    - Design your layout (location coordinates) by using virtual coordinates. Be aware that all location methods of hands and cards (cardActors) takes and returns virtual coordinates. (Other actors still use the real coordinate system).

    In SPLIT mode the screen is divided into a square game board positioned left in LANDSCAPE orientation and on the top in PORTRAIT orientation. The remaining playground can be used for action controls (buttons, status text, etc.). To position these controls, use a virtual coordinate system as shown below and transform virtual locations to real locations with Location.toReal(). Only fixed device orientation is supported.

    Virtual coordinate systen with LANDSCAPE device orientation:
    BoardType: HORZ_SPLIT, windowZoom(1000)
              (0,0)        (1000,0)   (getVirtualPgWidth(),0)
            o--------------o-------o
            |              |       |
            |              |       |
            |     Card     |Control|
            |     Area     |Area   |
            |              |       |
            |              |       |
            o--------------o-------o    
          (0,1000)    (1000,1000)  (getVirtualPgWidth(),1000)


    Virtual coordinate systen with PORTRAIT device orientation:
    BoardType: HORZ_SPLIT, windowZoom(1000)
                  (0,0)       (1000,0)
                o--------------o
                |              |
                |              |
                |    Card      |
                |    Area      |
                |              |
                |              |
       (0,1000) o--------------o (1000,1000)
                |    Control   |
                |    Area      |
                o--------------o
 (0, getVirtualPgHeight())   (1000, getVirtualPgHeight())

    • Constructor Detail

      • CardGame

        public CardGame(int boardColor,
        int borderColor,
        CardGame.BoardType boardType,
        GameGrid.WindowZoom windowZoom)
        Constructs and shows a game grid window of given BoardType layout with given border and background color. The simulation period is set to 30 ms. The WindowZoom parameter determines the zoom factor that is applied the size of the cards and to all hand and card locations when the cards are displayed.
        Parameters:
        boardColor - the background color of the card board
        borderColor - the color a surrounding border (Color.TRANSPARENT for no border)
        boardType - of of the enumerations of enum BoardType
        windowZoom - a WindowZoom reference to define the zoom factor. Use windowZoom(int windowSize) to create it; if null, the images are not zoomed

    • Method Detail

      • getBoardSize

        public int getBoardSize()
        Returns the (real) size of the square card playground in pixel units. The number of pixels in the horizontal and vertical direction is size + 1. The virutal size is equal to the windowZoom() parameter.
        Returns:
        the size of the playground in pixel units

      • getBoardType

        public CardGame.BoardType getBoardType()
        Returns the current BoardType enumeration.
        Returns:
        the BoardType enumeration
